2.text: Hear diligently my speech; And let this be your consolations.

3.text: Suffer me, that I may speak; And after that I have spoken, mock on.

4.text: As for me, is my complaint to man? Or why should I not be impatient?

5.text: Turn unto me, and be astonished, And lay your hand upon your mouth.

6.text: Even when I remember I am affrighted, And horror hath taketh hold on my flesh.

7.text: Wherefore do the wicked live, Become old, yea, wax mighty in power?

8.text: Their seed is established in their sight with them, And their offspring before their eyes.

9.text: Their houses are safe, without fear, Neither is the rod of God upon them.

10.text: Their bull gendereth, and faileth not; Their cow calveth, and casteth not her calf.

11.text: They send forth their little ones like a flock, And their children dance.

12.text: They sing to the timbrel and harp, And rejoice at the sound of the pipe.

13.text: They spend their days in prosperity, And peacefully they go down to the grave.

14.text: Yet they said unto God: ‘Depart from us; For we desire not the knowledge of Thy ways.

15.text: What is the Almighty, that we should serve Him? And what profit should we have, if we pray unto Him?’—

16.text: Lo, their prosperity is not in their hand; The counsel of the wicked is far from me.

17.text: How oft is it that the lamp of the wicked is put out? That their calamity cometh upon them? That He distributeth pains in His anger?

18.text: That they are as stubble before the wind, And as chaff that the storm stealeth away?

19.text: God layeth up his iniquity for his children!’—Let Him recompense it unto himself, that he may know it.

20.text: Let his own eyes see his destruction, And let him drink of the wrath of the Almighty.

21.text: For what pleasure hath he in his house after him? Seeing the number of his months is determined.

22.text: Shall any teach God knowledge? Seeing it is He that judgeth those that are high.

23.text: One dieth in his full strength, Being wholly at ease and quiet;

24.text: His pails are full of milk, And the marrow of his bones is moistened.

25.text: And another dieth in bitterness of soul, And hath never tasted of good.

26.text: They lie down alike in the dust, And the worm covereth them.

27.text: Behold, I know your thoughts, And the devices which ye wrongfully imagine against me.

28.text: For ye say: ‘Where is the house of the prince? And where is the tent wherein the wicked dwelt?’

29.text: Have ye not asked them that go by the way; And will ye misdeem their tokens,

30.text: That the evil man is reserved to the day of calamity, That they are led forth to the day of wrath?

31.text: But who shall declare his way to his face? And who shall repay him what he hath done?

32.text: For he is borne to the grave, And watch is kept over his tomb.

33.text: The clods of the valley are sweet unto him, And all men draw after him, As there were innumerable before him.

34.text: How then comfort ye me in vain? And as for your answers, there remaineth only faithlessness?
